paper_abstract: In this paper. linear local tangent space alignment (LLTSA), as a novel linear dimensionality reduction algorithm, is proposed. It uses the tangent space in the neighborhood of a data point to represent the local geometry, and then aligns those local tangent spaces in the low-dimensional space which is linearly mapped from the raw high-dimensional space. Since images of faces often belong to a manifold of intrinsically low dimension, we develop LLTSA algorithm for effective face manifold learning and recognition. Comprehensive comparisons and extensive experiments show that LLTSA achieves much higher recognition rates than a few competing methods. (c) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Linear local tangent space alignment and application to face recognition
